newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada leading indicator rises 0.4 pct in August.
newsitem.headline: Canada leading indicator rises 0.4 pct in August.

text.p: The Canadian composite leading indicator rose 0.4 percent in August to 179.7 (base 1981) from 178.9 in July, Statistics Canada said on Thursday.

The indicator foreshadows economic activity by tabulating figures for sectors that rise or fall in advance of broader movements in the economy. The figure is "smoothed", reflecting a moving average of approximately the past five months.
The unsmoothed index, reflecting the past month only, rose 0.6 percent in the month to 181.4.
A Reuter survey of economists had forecast the smoothed index to rise 0.5 percent.
